title: George A. Best
text:
George A. Best was an English <a href="association%20footballer">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>. He played professionally for <a href="Blackpool%20F.C.">Blackpool</a> in the early 20th century, either side of spells with his hometown club, <a href="Worksop%20Town%20F.C.">Worksop Town</a>.
Best made his debut for Blackpool just over halfway through the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Blackpool%20F.C.%20season">1925–26</a> season, as deputy for <a href="Len%20Crompton">Len Crompton</a>, in a 5–2 defeat at Derby County. He appeared in the two successive games — a 3–0 home victory over Bradford City and a 5–0 reversal at Port Vale — before Crompton returned to the line-up.
The following <a href="1926%E2%80%9327%20Blackpool%20F.C.%20season">1926–27</a> campaign saw Best make 24 <a href="Football%20League">League</a> appearances. He played his final game for the club on 18 April, in a 2–2 draw at South Shields.
